title: Powell: Exposing UofL sex scandal about money

Video by Jeff Faughender 9 of 10 VIDEOS | LOUISVILLE BASKETBALL KATINA POWELL SCANDAL Video | Pitino addresses media about recent allegations | 18:52 Louisville coach Rick Pitino says he was heartbroken when he heard the allegations that a former staff memeber purchased escorts for players/recruits. 10 of 10 Pitino talks escort allegations at Cards Luncheon Joel Klatt Isn't Buying That Rick Pitino Didn't Know About Sex Parties - 'The Herd' Jason Whitlock Doesn't See the Big Deal with the Louisville Sex Scandal Ex-Escort: I Was Paid $10K to Bring Girls for Sex with Basketball Recruits Video | Is Sex a Common Part of Recruiting Trips? - 'The Herd' Video | Louisville Sex Parties Were Run Like a Business - 'The Herd' Video | The Big Lead: What's Next at Louisville? Rick Pitino: 'The truth will come out' Video | Jeff Greer discusses the UofL book scandal Video | Pitino addresses media about recent allegations Katina Powell speaks to ABC News (Photo: ABC News) 672 CONNECT 37 TWEET 2 LINKEDIN 24 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
In an interview with Katina Powell on ABC's "The View" on Friday, the self-described "escort queen" says "it's about the book and the money" for why she exposed the alleged University of Louisville basketball sex scandal. 
She also said she called the NCAA to tell her story, but the NCAA "did nothing about it" regarding sex parties for players and recruits. 
Powell appeared on the ABC talk show “The View” at 11 a.m. Friday to discuss her allegations that she was paid by a former member of the University of Louisville basketball staff to provide escorts to strip for players and recruits. 
Some of the escorts, including two of her daughters, say they also had sex with the athletes. Andre McGee resigns from UMKC 
In her book, “Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen,” Powell alleges she was paid thousands of dollars and given game tickets by former U of L director of basketball operations Andre McGee. McGee’s attorney, Scott C. Cox, said McGee knew Powell but never paid for escorts to have sex with players or recruits. 
Investigations of the allegations are ongoing by the NCAA and state prosecutors. 
Powell wrote that her own daughters were among the escorts. She has since said they were not minors at the time and that she didn’t personally profit. 
According to an ESPN report released this week, five former U of L players or recruits backed up Powell’s account of parties with strippers, while one former recruit confirmed he had sex with one of the women. 
McGee resigned Friday morning as assistant basketball coach at the University of Missouri-Kansas City. 
McGee had been placed on administrative leave at UMKC after the publication Powell’s book. 
McGee, who has not publicly responded to Powell’s claims, said in an email to the athletic director of the Kansas City school that he had “reluctantly” decided to resign because the team deserves a full-time assistant and he was not able to provide that “while the false allegations against me are investigated.” 
Cox declined comment Friday but previously said McGee "has never supplied a prostitute or escort to a player or recruit at the University of Louisville." #UofLscandal Katina Powell's daughters say anyone in dorm Minardi Hall would have know of wild strip and sex parties with bball recruits. — Beth Warren (@BethWarrenCJ) October 23, 2015 #UofLscandal Katina Powell says ex- U of L bball staffer Andre McGee told her coach Rick Pitino would have know of sex parties with recruits — Beth Warren (@BethWarrenCJ) October 23, 2015 #UofLscandal Katina Powell says she kept journals of U of L on-campus sex parties"for my own protection." — Beth Warren (@BethWarrenCJ) October 23, 2015 #UofLscandal Rod Ni Powell, Katina Powell's daughter, admitted to sex with players. "Everybody was grown. It was just something fun to do."
